channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rapamycin and Anti-Aging: What to Know
item.description: Rapamycin is typically prescribed as an immunosuppressive, but off-label users believe it can do much more.

item.title: U.N. General Assembly: U.N. Live Updates: Biden Warns That World Faces an ‘Inflection Point’ Amid Global Turmoil
item.description: In his final U.N. speech, President Biden addressed the wars in Ukraine, the Middle East and Sudan, drawing on the long arc of his career to stress th...

item.title: Stop romanticizing in-office watercooler talk. As a fully distributed company of 12,000 people, here’s what really works
item.description: Serendipitous in-office interactions are fun, but they have an adverse effect on the people who weren’t in that conversation.

item.title: Strange Cellmates in a Brooklyn Jail: Sean Combs and Sam Bankman-Fried
item.description: Mr. Combs is sleeping in the same dormitory-style room as Mr. Bankman-Fried, the crypto mogul who was convicted of fraud.

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Launches More Strikes on Hezbollah, as Thousands Flee Southern Lebanon
item.description: Lebanon health officials said Israeli attacks since Monday have killed hundreds, including women and children. Israel claimed it had killed one senior...

item.title: Coke pulls its latest ‘permanent’ flavor from store shelves after just six months
Mark Zuckerberg’s Political Evolution
item.description: He was once a backer of liberal causes. Then everyone seemed to turn on him. Now he wants to stay away from politics — if that’s possible.

item.title: Escalation in the Middle East Looms Over the General Assembly Meeting
WEF Chair Klaus Schwab: It took just under 4 years to connect 1B people to vital digital services. We must redouble our efforts as the world enters the age of AI
item.description: 'Empowering 1 billion lives digitally is an extraordinary achievement—but it is only the beginning,' writes Klaus Schwab.

item.title: Biden Warns the World Is at an ‘Inflection Point’
item.description: The president celebrated his defense of Ukraine and restoration of global alliances but warned that a world filled with crises looms outside.

item.title: How a Leftist Jolted Sri Lanka’s Politics and Presidency
item.description: Anura Kumara Dissanayake offered his broad leftist coalition as the best hope for a different political culture, one not ruled by nepotism and corrupt...

item.title: People you’ve blocked on Twitter/X will now be able to see your posts again
item.description: But they won’t be able to interact.

item.title: Tropical Storm John Pummels Mexico’s Pacific Coast
item.description: John made landfall in the state of Guerrero as a Category 3 storm on Monday. It then weakened to a tropical storm, bringing heavy rain and the threat ...

item.title: Moo Deng Is the Internet’s Favorite Pygmy Hippopotamus
item.description: Moo Deng, whose name translates to “bouncy pork,” has united the internet while following a familiar path to stardom.

item.title: Perfectionism is not healthy or sustainable. Here’s what to strive for instead
item.description: There is a problem with tying our self-worth to our achievements so much that we fear to make mistakes.
